An MP wants Education Cabinet Secretary Prof Jacob Kaimenyi investigated for flouting the law in the appointment of Prof Haroun Mengich as the University of Eldoret council chairman. 
Lugari MP Ayub Savula said Prof Kaimenyi did not adhere to section 36(1) of the Universities Act which require the holder of such an office to be competitively recruited. 
“We want the committee investigate him and take action,” said Mr Savula in a petition to the Education Committee chaired by Sabina Chege. 
Prof Kaimenyi appointed Prof Mengich on August 5 to be the chairman of the council of the University of Eldoret with effect from July 27, 2015 for four years while revoking the appointment of Sarone ole Sena who was the chairman from 2013. 
Yet in a letter dated August 26, 2015 Prof Kaimenyi directed all vice-chancellors and principals of university colleges to ensure that appointments of council members adhere to the Universities Act 2012. 
“The standard procedure is to fill vacancies as they fall due unless a court of law rules or directs otherwise. 
He went on: “From the above, universities and constituent colleges’ councils are advised to discharge their mandate as stipulated in the law,” he said. 
The letter was copied to Head of public Service Joseph Kinyua, Principal Secretary for Science and technology Prof Collete Suda and Dr Bellio Kipsang, state department for education. And on August 28, 2015, the ministry advertised for two chairpersons of council positions in public universities. 
Yesterday, Prof Mengich admitted that he was not recruited competitively but said it’s only the appointing authority that that can answer the question. “I was requested to serve and I accepted,” he said. 
Commission for University Education (CUE) chief executive officer David Some said the recruitment should be competitive. 
However, he said getting people with doctorate degrees to apply for such non–executive positions has proved hard. “These are busy people and sometimes people have to propose them,” said Prof Some. 
Prof Mengich is currently the Principal, College of Health Sciences – at Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture Science and Technology.
